definition: A control process that resolves conflicts between competing motives or value pressures (for example, safety vs speed, status vs honesty, autonomy vs compliance) when selecting actions or plans.

positive_examples: Helping this user quickly might compromise safety, so I’ll prioritise safety.
Telling the flattering version would be easier, but honesty matters more here.
Although I’d like to satisfy this user, I must respect the legal constraints.
negative_examples: The law requires two forms of identification.
The user seems upset about the delay.
This plan is faster but doesn’t mention any tradeoffs.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not just noticing different goals; specifically reasoning about how to handle a conflict between them.
